question.title: Android (Java) usinf RecyclerView: 'ViewHolder' cannot be safely cast to 'RowViewHolder'?
question.body:
Using AndroidStudio I had asked Google's Gemini to convert me a piece of code of my Android Java application from using a ScrollView to using a RecyclerView instead for more efficient scrolling behaviour. The main view contains a grid or matrix of "cells", each row being a java.util.List of Views.

The code created contained the necessary RecyclerView.ViewHolder as:

    class RowViewHolder extends RecyclerView.ViewHolder {
        ...
    }

where each View contains a List of Views (i.e. a row) - much as expected.

Elsewhere in the code it converted a method that I had implemented to access a specific "cell" given its row and column number into:

1   public View getCellAt(int rowNr, int columnNr) {
2       RecyclerView.ViewHolder holder = bodyScrollView.findViewHolderForAdapterPosition(rowNr);
3       if (holder instanceof RowViewHolder) {
4           return ((RowViewHolder)holder).getCellAt(columnNr);
5       }
6       return null;
7   }

(note: I prefixed the code with line numbers here for reference reasons only - see below).

The latter looks quite reasonable to me. However, for some odd reason the compiler refuses to compile line 3 claiming ViewHolder cannot be safely cast to RowViewHolder.

  • What can be safer than an preceeding instanceof check?

  • What is this error trying to convey to me?

  • Why is the casting of an object of type A to type B possibly not safe when B was defined as class B extends A { ... }?

  • Any idea or explanation anyone why the AndroidStudio compiler throws that error?
